Johns Hopkins has an extensive collection of data.  Let's see what one set looks like.

```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(leaflet); library(tidyverse); library(rMaps); library(leaflet.extras)
March25JH <- read_csv(url("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/CSSEGISandData/COVID-19/master/csse_covid_19_data/csse_covid_19_daily_reports/03-25-2020.csv"))
March25JH <- March25JH %>% mutate(Long = Long_)
library(leaflet)
L2 <- leaflet(March25JH) %>% 
  addTiles() %>% 
#  addCircles(lng = ~Long, lat = ~Lat, weight = 1, radius = 1, popup = ~Combined_Key) %>% 
  addHeatmap(lng=~Long,
             lat=~Lat,
             radius = 9,
             intensity = ~Confirmed)
library(widgetframe)
frameWidget(L2)
```
